PIONEER EXPERIENCES

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to everyone; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Don't hesitate to give answers, even if they are insufficient; most of them will help to describe the particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate pages or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark those ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer life
( ) Pioneer schools
( ) Pioneer churches
( ) Pioneer recreation and social life
( ) Pioneer farming experiences
( ) Pioneers in Saskatchewan
( ) Pioneer health and housing

Preparation of Questionnaire

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have written it, please say so.

It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your election.

1. Your full name: Laura Welsh, Laura Welsh (signature)
2. Your address: New Argenteuil
3. Date: January 16, 1943
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Hugh E. Smith, Grandfather
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Hugh E. Smith, Farmer
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): April 1905
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan: about 1878, after April 1905, when a baby
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use I was a small child, I was in my teens, etc.): eight years old
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: my father wanted to better himself
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? My brother's letters made me curious, I was going to the Todale district. His stories of the country influenced my father.

my father worked at little family

my mother's brother wrote me a story about going in the Wichita district. She also told me about the country and influenced my father.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

We traveled by train as a family.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Train

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents, etc.)

Just arrived in Winnipeg came to camp.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

At a boarding house run by the minister's family.

Then worked at local lumber mill for a month.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Settled on homestead at New Poplar.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

I lived for about 4 years in M. S. N.

Between 1923 to 1927.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

At a boarding house, then they had no family.

Lived on homestead at New Argyle.

My father, Hughie, was one of the first members of the First Federal Credit Union. He served as its president until 1977.

My father, Hughie, was one of the first members of the First Federal Credit Union. He served as its president until 1977.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were victims to have or do something in the district section (for example, giving dates, driving cars, etc.), please describe what happened.

38. How old were children in your community when their parents died? (School attendance, age, etc.)

(1) Some of them were very young; (2) Others were older; (3) All of them were very young.

(1) Our school was closed by the death of our teacher.

(2) We were very young; (3) Some of us were very young.

(4) About 1910.
